ascendant:
ASCENDANT — YOUR VIBE, AESTHETIC & OPENING SCENE ENERGY
→ Your Ascendant sign sets the visual tone and 'opening scene energy' of your story. It’s the filter of your filmic world — how you appear, how the camera first meets you, and the vibe you project into every frame.
sun_sign:
SUN SIGN — YOUR CORE CHARACTER ARC
→ The Sun represents your protagonist energy — the hero of your narrative. It shows what drives you, what you express most vividly, and the arc your character must follow to feel alive.
sun_house:
SUN IN THE HOUSES — THE GENRE OR SETTING OF YOUR LIFE STORY
→ The house where your Sun lives reveals the genre and environment where your story unfolds — from the quiet indie realism of House 6 to the epic adventure scope of House 9.
chart_ruler:
CHART RULER IN THE HOUSES — WHERE YOUR STORY UNFOLDS
→ The chart ruler (planet ruling your Ascendant) shows where your story actually happens — the house gives the life domain, the sign adds the aesthetic. Think of this as the 'set design' of your cosmic stage.
moon_sign:
MOON SIGN — YOUR EMOTIONAL CINEMATOGRAPHY
→ The Moon colors your film’s lighting and emotional pacing. It reflects how you process feelings, find comfort, and express vulnerability — the emotional rhythm behind your plot.
summary:
CLOSING SCENE — YOUR SIGNATURE MOOD
→ This is the tone that lingers after the credits. The composite of your Ascendant, Sun, and Ruler tells us your signature cinematic mood — how your story feels when the lights come up.
